projects.description: Allows user to view courses from an SQL database. When authenicated the user can also create, update, and delete courses from the library. Users can sign-up for an account, and their credentials are encrypted and stored in the database as well.

A video game built using JavaScript and Phaser. Player moves paddle left and right using arrows on keyboard and tries to knockout as many bricks as possible. It keeps the users running score thoughout the 5 levels.
An interactive form that dynamically changes based on user inputs. Form also checks required fields against specific criteria before form will submit.

A word game that pulls a phrase at random from a bank of phrases. The user selects characters from the on-screen keyboard, and when the selected letter is in the secret phrase it reveals the correct letter and marks the keybarod key a different color to mark it correct. If the user is wrong it removes a heart and marks the key a color to mark it incorrect. The game ends when the user either loses all 5 hearts or correctly identifies all the letters in the hidden phrase.

The directory accessing a public API containing contact info data, and pulls the contact info of 12 random people that match criteria put into a query. The user is able to click on a contact card to open up a window that displays more information about the selected person, and then close the opened window to keep viewing the data.
An express app that lets user view a database of books. Users are also able to create, update, and delete books from the library.

User can enter a search query that will search images from the flickr api then post the images that match the query to the page. There are also 3 pre-determined searches that the user can click on to use as their search query.

App either obtains the user's current location or user input to pull the weather data from a weather api, and then render the current weather conditions. The user can then see a 5 day forecast of the selected location by clicking a button.
